intro: Sebastiania larensis, commonly known as the Larensis beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking clusters of violet to purple berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly rough texture. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, often hidden within the leaf axils, while the showy berries mature in late summer to early fall.
